original: 一髻文殊師利童子陀羅尼念
analyzed: 一髻文殊師利童子陀羅尼念

original: 誦儀軌🔽􄖩曩􄗭謨引􄗯曼􄒺祚􄭟室哩二合􄗷曳平聲一􄑄矩􄗦麼鼻引
analyzed: 誦儀軌 􄖩曩􄗭謨引􄗯曼􄒺祚􄭟室哩二合􄗷曳平聲一􄑄矩􄗦麼鼻引
translated: The Dhāraṇī and Recitation Ritual of Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta with a Single Topknot

original: 􄗽羅􄗞部引􄖪跢􄗱野二􄕗怛􄟰涅􄕤他引􇩂唵引􈇖室哩二合􄑀伽去引􄙊攞􄖻陛四􄗥摩􄚰護􄑀佉􅛲攞陛五􆿅阿上􄙊攞􄗥麼鼻􄑀伽􅛲攞陛二合􄙺娑􄗥麼􄙺三去􄗥滿􆩖多􄑀伽􅛲攞陛􅁥娑嚩二合􄚩賀爾時文殊師利法王子於大眾中說此陀羅尼已。
analyzed: 􄗽羅􄗞部引􄖪跢􄗱野二􄕗怛􄟰涅􄕤他引􇩂唵引􈇖室哩二合􄑀伽去引􄙊攞􄖻陛四􄗥摩􄚰護􄑀佉􅛲攞陛五􆿅阿上􄙊攞􄗥麼鼻􄑀伽􅛲攞陛二合􄙺娑􄗥麼􄙺三去􄗥滿􆩖多􄑀伽􅛲攞陛􅁥娑嚩二合􄚩賀爾時文殊師利法王子於大眾中說此陀羅尼已。
translated: Namo manjusriye kumārabhūtāya | oṃ cālaka cālaka | moha kha kha | āloka āloka | moha kha kha | amogha pūja megha saṃbhava svāhā At that time, Mañjuśrī, the Prince of the Dharma, having spoken this dhāraṇī within the great assembly,
all tathāgatas in the worlds of the ten directions,
the devas, nāgas, and the eight groups of beings,
and the entire great assembly all praised together, saying,

original: 善哉善哉文殊師利童真菩薩摩訶薩。
analyzed: 善哉善哉文殊師利童真菩薩摩訶薩。
translated: Excellent, excellent! Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta Bodhisattva Mahāsattva,
you have made a vow with the power of great compassion.

original: 於惡世中為欲󰻑愍薄福有情故。
analyzed: 於惡世中為欲󰻑愍薄福有情故。
translated: In this evil world, for the sake of sentient beings with little merit,

original: 善能演說此不可思議如意摩尼妙法寶藏。
analyzed: 善能演說此不可思議如意摩尼妙法寶藏。
translated: You are able to expound this inconceivable wish-fulfilling jewel of the wonderful Dharma treasure,
Benefiting sentient beings and creating inexhaustible blessings and benefits.

original: 爾時文殊師利告大眾言。
analyzed: 爾時文殊師利告大眾言。
translated: At that time, Mañjuśrī said to the great assembly,

original: 我於過去佛所授得此陀羅尼。
analyzed: 我於過去佛所授得此陀羅尼。
translated: I have received this dhāraṇī from past buddhas.

original: 每於減劫眾生福盡之處即宣說。
analyzed: 每於減劫眾生福盡之處即宣說。
translated: Whenever the blessings of sentient beings are exhausted in the declining eon, I proclaim it,

original: 令彼惡世善男子善女人比丘比丘尼優婆塞優婆夷求菩提道。
analyzed: 令彼惡世善男子善女人比丘比丘尼優婆塞優婆夷求菩提道。
translated: Enabling the good men, good women, bhikṣus, bhikṣuṇīs, upāsakas, and upāsikās in that evil world who seek the path of enlightenment,

original: 導一切眾生速令成就一切善事。
analyzed: 導一切眾生速令成就一切善事。
translated: To guide all sentient beings and quickly accomplish all good things,
In order to transcend the great sea of suffering in birth and death.
I encourage them to uphold this wondrous and divine verse.

original: 若善男子善女人晝夜精勤。
analyzed: 若善男子善女人晝夜精勤。
translated: If good men and good women diligently recite this dhāraṇī day and night,

original: 常誦此陀羅尼憶念不忘。
analyzed: 常誦此陀羅尼憶念不忘。
translated: Remembering it without forgetting,
Or simply praising its inconceivable power,
Encouraging others to believe and accept it,
Recite this dhāraṇī with utmost sincerity.
Practice the conduct of benefiting others.
This good man or good woman

original: 無始已來所有一切五無間等諸惡罪業悉皆消滅。
analyzed: 無始已來所有一切五無間等諸惡罪業悉皆消滅。
translated: Will have all the evil karma and offenses committed since beginningless time, such as the five heinous crimes, completely eliminated.
They will never sink and drown in the great ocean of birth and death.
They will forever be free from the fear of the three evil paths.
In every life they will attain the wisdom of remembering past lives.
Their six sense faculties will be pure and they will be endowed with all the characteristics.
They will have a wonderful appearance, be upright and dignified, and have blazing majestic virtue.
All their wishes will be fulfilled.
If they first uphold other mantras,
All will be accomplished.
Whatever they undertake will be exceptionally excellent.
If one is able to uphold this dhāraṇī,

original: 先曾毀犯尸羅三業虧失。
analyzed: 先曾毀犯尸羅三業虧失。
translated: Even if they have previously violated the precepts and their three karmas are deficient,
They will all attain purity.
They will eliminate all the evil karma and offenses of breaking the precepts.
They will forever leave the evil paths and always be reborn in the human and heavenly realms.
Their faculties will be well-regulated and their wisdom will be pure.
They will attain unobstructed eloquence in all matters.
In the true Dharma, one attains the power of deep faith.
Whatever one says, the listener will believe and accept it.
Among enemies, one will always be superior.

original: 一切怨家永息惡心不能相害。
analyzed: 一切怨家永息惡心不能相害。
translated: All enemies will forever cease their evil thoughts and will not be able to harm each other.
All devas and nagas will always follow and protect.
Vast and great blessings and virtues will be spontaneously accomplished.
Those who see will submit.

original: 以我悲願深厚無盡福惠饒益一切眾生。
analyzed: 以我悲願深厚無盡福惠饒益一切眾生。
translated: By my compassionate vows, which are profound, abundant, inexhaustible, and beneficial to all sentient beings,

original: 十方如來諸大菩薩之所護念。
analyzed: 十方如來諸大菩薩之所護念。
translated: I am protected by the Tathagatas of the ten directions and the great Bodhisattvas.
The multitude of sages empower me.
By the power of my vows,
All liberations will be accomplished.
I will now further explain.
For those who uphold this dharani,

original: 畫像道場供養儀式求成就法行者。
analyzed: 畫像道場供養儀式求成就法行者。
translated: The ritual for painting the image, establishing the altar, making offerings, and seeking accomplishment,

original: 應先擇願宿曜吉祥之日。
analyzed: 應先擇願宿曜吉祥之日。
translated: One should first choose a day with auspicious stars and planets.
The painter should uphold the eight precepts and be pure.
On white silk or on silk or paper,

original: 畫一髻文殊師利菩薩童子形。
analyzed: 畫一髻文殊師利菩薩童子形。
translated: Paint the form of the youthful Manjushri with a topknot.

original: 金色半跏坐千葉白蓮花上。
analyzed: 金色半跏坐千葉白蓮花上。
translated: Seated in half-lotus posture, upon a white lotus flower with a thousand petals.
The left hand holds a blue lotus flower.
On the flower is a wish-fulfilling jewel.

original: 右手指掌向外垂下五指作滿願印。
analyzed: 右手指掌向外垂下五指作滿願印。
translated: The right hand points outward with the five fingers in the mudrā of fulfilling wishes.
Smiling gently with a sense of joy.

original: 種種珠鬘頭冠瓔珞莊嚴其身。
analyzed: 種種珠鬘頭冠瓔珞莊嚴其身。
translated: Adorned with various pearl necklaces, crowns, and necklaces.
Having painted this image,
In a clean room, smear and wipe the square altar.
Arrange the positions of the three courtyards from the inside to the outside.
Install the seventeen honored ones.

original: 具如如五字輪瑜伽法中所說。
analyzed: 具如如五字輪瑜伽法中所說。
translated: Fully as explained in the Yoga Method of the Five-Character Wheel.

original: 應以上妙香美餅菓子精誠供養。
analyzed: 應以上妙香美餅菓子精誠供養。
translated: One should make offerings with the utmost sincerity of excellent incense, beautiful cakes, and fruits.
Place this image facing east on the altar.
The practitioner faces west.
Facing east, facing the image.

original: 應取白月八日起首念誦。
analyzed: 應取白月八日起首念誦。
translated: One should begin reciting on the eighth day of the bright half of the month.

original: 每日誦前真言八百遍或一千遍。
analyzed: 每日誦前真言八百遍或一千遍。
translated: Recite the mantra in front of the image eight hundred or one thousand times each day.

original: 便於像前臥一心思念我文殊取睡。
analyzed: 便於像前臥一心思念我文殊取睡。
translated: Then, in front of the image, lie down and single-mindedly think of me, Mañjuśrī, and take sleep.

original: 則於夢中必見文殊作小童子形。
analyzed: 則於夢中必見文殊作小童子形。
translated: Then, in dreams, one will definitely see Mañjuśrī in the form of a young boy.
If one sees this sign,
one should know that one has already received his empowerment.
All wishes and intentions will be fulfilled.
All that one seeks will be attained.
The teachings one speaks will be believed and accepted by all people.

original: 又法取蜜哩底藥此名白胡桝誦前真言加持八千遍已。
analyzed: 又法取蜜哩底藥此名白胡桝誦前真言加持八千遍已。
translated: Furthermore, take some miridhi medicine (also known as white beard huan), recite the previous mantra and empower it 8,000 times.
Place it in the mouth.
If one goes to the palace of the king or to the place of hundreds of officials,
whatever one seeks will be attained.

original: 所說言教信受伏從不敢違逆。
analyzed: 所說言教信受伏從不敢違逆。
translated: The teachings one speaks will be believed and accepted, and no one will dare to go against them.

original: 又法取帝支縛底藥此名貝多皮陰乾以前真言加持八千遍。
analyzed: 又法取帝支縛底藥此名貝多皮陰乾以前真言加持八千遍。
translated: Furthermore, take some tianzhibajidi medicine (also known as beitaopi), recite the previous mantra 8,000 times,
place it in a bowl, and beg for food while holding it.

original: 所須飲食衣服乃至金銀七寶須者皆得。
analyzed: 所須飲食衣服乃至金銀七寶須者皆得。
translated: Whatever food, drink, clothing, up to gold, silver, the seven treasures, and other necessities one needs will all be obtained.
Many people will love and respect one, competing to make offerings.
In all disputes, one will be victorious.
Furthermore, on the eighth day of the bright fortnight,
In front of this image of Mañjuśrī,
light incense and eat the three white foods.

original: 又以白食及種種白花燒白檀香供養。
analyzed: 又以白食及種種白花燒白檀香供養。
translated: Also, with white food and various white flowers, burn white sandalwood incense as offerings.
Recite this mantra 8,000 times.
When the number of recitations is complete,
then go to sleep in front of the image.

original: 我文殊師利為現其淨妙色身。
analyzed: 我文殊師利為現其淨妙色身。
translated: I, Mañjuśrī, will manifest my pure and wondrous physical body.
All wishes will be fulfilled.
Every day, I will always give 1,000 gold coins.
You should not hoard them.

original: 總將供供養三寶及修功德。
analyzed: 總將供供養三寶及修功德。
translated: Take them all to make offerings to the Three Jewels and cultivate merit and virtue.
Recite it 800 times every day.
Make offerings according to your ability and circumstances.
You should not interrupt.

original: 又法以一銀鉢加持一百八遍或八百遍或二十一遍。
analyzed: 又法以一銀鉢加持一百八遍或八百遍或二十一遍。
translated: Furthermore, take a silver bowl, empower it 108 times, 800 times, or 21 times,

original: 於文殊師利像前安白練上。
analyzed: 於文殊師利像前安白練上。
translated: place it on top of a white silk cloth in front of the image of Mañjuśrī,
and cover it with a white silk cloth.
After one night, in the morning, take the bowl in your hands.
You will obtain 800 gold coins.

original: 如上所作諸法當宜密作。
analyzed: 如上所作諸法當宜密作。
translated: All the above practices should be done secretly.
One should not let anyone know or hear about them,

original: 唯除同行願同求此事者。
analyzed: 唯除同行願同求此事者。
translated: Except for a fellow practitioner who shares the same aspiration and seeks the same matter.
A close companion, one person.
One must not speak of it to outsiders.
The power of empowerment will be lost immediately.
One must be discreet.
If one can follow the teachings and be careful,

original: 日日金錢常供更無斷施。
analyzed: 日日金錢常供更無斷施。
translated: Gold coins will always be provided daily, and the offering will never be interrupted.
The above practices cannot be done all at once.
One should simply accomplish one matter according to one's preference.
One still needs to first purify one's body and mind.
Frequently drink the five nectars of the cow.
Arouse a compassionate mind.
Day and night, diligently follow the teachings without deficiency.
One will surely attain the supreme siddhi in this life.
The mind mantra states:

original: 􈁴唵引􄙺娑􄗥麼􆩖那􈇖始哩二合􆿁吽􅁥娑嚩二合􄚩賀隨心真言􈁴唵引􆿅阿􄙢捨􄗥摩􄕍𩕳􆿁吽􅁥娑嚩二合􄚩賀結壇界真言􇩂唵􄕵禰􄙢捨􄗥摩􄕍寧􆿁吽引􅁥娑嚩二合􄚩賀結四方界真言􇩂唵引􄙺三􄗥摩􄖩難􄕗多吉􄗥摩􄕍寧􆿁吽􅁥娑嚩二合􄚩賀以此真言加持水二十一遍。
analyzed: 􈁴唵引􄙺娑􄗥麼􆩖那􈇖始哩二合􆿁吽􅁥娑嚩二合􄚩賀隨心真言􈁴唵引􆿅阿􄙢捨􄗥摩􄕍𩕳􆿁吽􅁥娑嚩二合􄚩賀結壇界真言􇩂唵􄕵禰􄙢捨􄗥摩􄕍寧􆿁吽引􅁥娑嚩二合􄚩賀結四方界真言􇩂唵引􄙺三􄗥摩􄖩難􄕗多吉􄗥摩􄕍寧􆿁吽􅁥娑嚩二合􄚩賀以此真言加持水二十一遍。
translated: Oṃ sādhu sādhu saṃ namaḥ śrīye hūṃ svāhā Heart mantra Oṃ aśeṣa māṃ ni hūṃ svāhā Altar boundary mantra Oṃ niśeṣa māṃ ni hūṃ svāhā Boundary of the four directions mantra Oṃ trimaṃ taṃ jaya māṃ ni hūṃ svāhā With this mantra, empower water twenty-one times.

original: 散於四面即成結界若常於文殊師利菩薩前持誦此真言。
analyzed: 散於四面即成結界若常於文殊師利菩薩前持誦此真言。
translated: Scatter it in the four directions to form a boundary. If one always recites this mantra in front of Mañjuśrī Bodhisattva,
reciting it eight hundred times a day without omission,
one will daily obtain five hundred gold coins.
One must then offer it to the Three Jewels.
One may only use a portion for oneself.

original: 不得求無義利處違教用之。
analyzed: 不得求無義利處違教用之。
translated: One must not use it in places that are not beneficial, in violation of the teachings.
One must not hoard it.

original: 應須每日常已種種餅菓供養文殊菩薩。
analyzed: 應須每日常已種種餅菓供養文殊菩薩。
translated: One should always offer various pastries and fruits to Mañjuśrī Bodhisattva.

original: 替拔及時分勿令不清淨。
analyzed: 替拔及時分勿令不清淨。
translated: One should not let the offerings be impure.
And one's own clothes must be extremely clean.
One should bathe frequently and not be dirty.
If one sees non-dharma monks or brahmins,

original: 或顏色樵顇或非威儀身形醜陋。
analyzed: 或顏色樵顇或非威儀身形醜陋。
translated: Or if their complexion is haggard or their deportment and physical appearance are ugly,
One must not belittle or slander them.

original: 以大聖文殊種種化現異類之身。
analyzed: 以大聖文殊種種化現異類之身。
translated: Because the great sage Mañjuśrī manifests various transformed bodies in different species,
Testing and subduing the minds of practitioners,

original: 欲令常起慈愍普皆平等。
analyzed: 欲令常起慈愍普皆平等。
translated: Wishing to always arouse compassion and be universally impartial,

original: 於一切有情生珍敬心無分別心。
analyzed: 於一切有情生珍敬心無分別心。
translated: Giving rise to a reverent mind towards all sentient beings, a mind without discrimination,
A mind without attachment, a mind without excessive love,
Vast and unobstructed.
One should always think of them as future Buddhas.

original: 修行者若能如是依教住無分別精勤持誦。
analyzed: 修行者若能如是依教住無分別精勤持誦。
translated: If practitioners are able to abide in this way without discrimination, diligently reciting the teachings,

original: 所求之願文殊大聖速為滿足。
analyzed: 所求之願文殊大聖速為滿足。
translated: The great sage Mañjuśrī will quickly fulfill their wishes.

original: 鉢中化變日常盈滿用無窮盡。
analyzed: 鉢中化變日常盈滿用無窮盡。
translated: The bowl will always be filled with transformed food, and its use will be inexhaustible.

original: 又法以昌𮑱根用前身真言加持八千返置鉢中。
analyzed: 又法以昌𮑱根用前身真言加持八千返置鉢中。
translated: Moreover, the method is to use the root of changzhi and add the previous mantra eight thousand times, placing it in the bowl.
Holding this bowl, enter the city to beg for alms.
Whatever clothes are needed can all be obtained according to one's wishes.

original: 又法取安悉香白檀香蘇合香。
analyzed: 又法取安悉香白檀香蘇合香。
translated: Moreover, take asafetida, white sandalwood, and olibanum.
Always use these three fragrances for offerings.

original: 於一切處常說燒此香不得間斷。
analyzed: 於一切處常說燒此香不得間斷。
translated: In all places, always say to burn these fragrances without interruption.
The wishes sought will be quickly fulfilled.
Moreover, take five-colored threads, one zhang long.
Recite the mantra and empower it one hundred and eight times.
Tie it into one knot, twenty-one knots in total.
Place the knotted thread in the bowl and place the image in front of it.
Make offerings according to one's ability.

original: 文殊日日於此鉢中現出上上黃金二十一兩。
analyzed: 文殊日日於此鉢中現出上上黃金二十一兩。
translated: Mañjuśrī will appear in this bowl every day, manifesting twenty-one taels of the finest gold.
This gold must not be kept or hoarded.

original: 施用修功德供養三寶用無盡竭。
analyzed: 施用修功德供養三寶用無盡竭。
translated: Use it to cultivate merit and make offerings to the Three Jewels, and it will be used up without end.
If it is stored and accumulated,
it will then disappear and not come out again.

original: 又法有藥名數沙波多那。
analyzed: 又法有藥名數沙波多那。
translated: There is also a medicine called Saubhāgya,

original: 亦名薩沙波此云白芥子。
analyzed: 亦名薩沙波此云白芥子。
translated: also called Sasapa (white mustard seed).

original: 又有藥名摩訶弭多此藥出蜀地。
analyzed: 又有藥名摩訶弭多此藥出蜀地。
translated: There is also a medicine called Mahāmṛta (great immortality). This medicine comes from the Shu region.

original: 若有大風大雨霖霔久不晴明者。
analyzed: 若有大風大雨霖霔久不晴明者。
translated: If there is a great wind, heavy rain, or a long-lasting drought,
place the above two medicines in one place.

original: 用身真言加持此二藥八千遍。
analyzed: 用身真言加持此二藥八千遍。
translated: Use the body mantra to empower these two medicines 8,000 times.
Throw them into the sky.
The wind and rain will then stop.
If it is a time of scorching drought with no rain,

original: 取數沙波多那加持八千遍。
analyzed: 取數沙波多那加持八千遍。
translated: take Saubhāgya and empower it 8,000 times.
Scatter it into the water where there are dragons.
Then it will immediately rain heavily.

original: 又法將持此加持藥散大戰陣中。
analyzed: 又法將持此加持藥散大戰陣中。
translated: There is also a method of taking this empowered medicine and scattering it in a great battle array.

original: 一切刀杖弓箭無堪用者。
analyzed: 一切刀杖弓箭無堪用者。
translated: All swords, staves, bows, and arrows will be unusable.
Even if used, they will definitely not cause injury.

analyzed: 若入王宮乃至大臣家諸百官家。

analyzed: 若散商人賈客之中。 貨物并無竊盜。
translated: If scattered among merchants and travelers,🔽their goods will not be stolen.
Ordinary thieves will not be able to encroach upon them.

translated: all ghosts, spirits, yakshas, rakshasas, and other strange creatures will not be able to harm.

There is no doubt.
